item.title: [git push -u origin main] Doesn’t Work
item.description: Background: GitHub changed their default branch name from “master” to “main”, but strangely, git push -u origin main doesn’t work on my Mac. git push -u origin masterworks fine, but this command automatically creates an unnecessary “master” branch for me. I want to figure

item.title: How to Update This Blog
item.description: This blog is built by Hugo and deployed to GitHub Pages. When updating new contents, I use Git pushing everything to the GitHub repository, and here are some memo to myself: #1 Write a post Open cmd, cd to hugo blog local folder. hugo new posts/“new post.md” Open “new po

item.title: Switch Between Multiple GitHub Accounts With SSH Keys
item.description: The following are some commands I use frequently when I switch between different GitHub accounts on my Mac. Use the following command to set a default Git account: Git config –global user.name "username1" Git config –global user.email "useremail1" Use the following command to switch to another Git account temporarily. Git config user.name "username1" Git config user.email "useremail1" Use
